meanings.definition: To transfer or pass from one to another
meanings.sent1: The nurse will transfuse blood from the donor to the patient.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will transfuse the medicine into the IV bag.
meanings.sent3: I tried to transfuse some of my energy to my tired friend, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's passion for learning transfused into her students, inspiring them.
meanings.sent5: The magician transfused the color from one handkerchief to another, leaving the audience amazed.

meanings.definition: To cause to pass from one to another
meanings.sent1: The chef will transfuse flavors into the dish by adding herbs and spices.
meanings.sent2: The electric current will transfuse energy into the battery, charging it.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to transfuse laughter into the audience, but they remained silent.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness transfused warmth into the room, making everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent5: The artist transfused emotion into the painting, creating a masterpiece.
